instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: 820 00840 not power on.
threads.message: well this one supposedly shut down whitout anything be done to it. i opened it up, not sign of any kind of damage. <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> was heating up so i replaced it. i got 5v volts on this port. but the other one was doing nothing. so i replaced <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> too. then now both ports are death, they dont show anu\ything on my usb c ampmeter.  so where do i go from here?

threads.title: 820 00840 not power on.
threads.message:
Did you use same code termination?
I think there is CD3215C00...

Something happened when you've changed the chips; at least with the second one.
Bad solders, or bad/incorrect chip.

threads.title: 820 00840 not power on.
threads.message: i checked and compared with original chips. its the same termination, the same one you put CD3215C00. im pretty confident with my soldering but, if you think is bad i can take them off and reball them. by the way i reflowed them...i tested for voltages too, and i dont get anything anywhere everything is 0v. i guess i gotta reball them, and if that doesnt work, replace both of them?

threads.title: 820 00840 not power on.
threads.message: well i reflowed them again just in case. now i get 5v volts on bottom port, with 0.3A. top port still dead. and bottom port only works on one side , if i turn it around, it doesnt work....corroded port?. i mean in these is supposed to work whatever way i plug it in.

threads.title: 820 00840 not power on.
threads.message: Compare diode mode readings on all power rails of both <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.

threads.title: 820 00840 not power on.
threads.message: which rails should i check?. sorry if its a dumb question, its my first time with one of these new models. i checked <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and i have 3.3v when the ampmeter its working and the bottom slot. else i get 0v on that rail!

threads.title: 820 00840 not power on.
threads.message:
<CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips have few different power rails; like 1V1, 1V8, 3V3, 5V.
Even not all these rails get voltage, a bad reading can points to a bad chip...

threads.title: 820 00840 not power on.
threads.message: well i got this. it was a shorted <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>. a brand new one was shorted :). I noticed because when i took out F3010,<CAPACITOR>C3404</CAPACITOR>,3201 and <DIODE>D3400</DIODE>, i still had short to ground. i write it jst in case it matters...i replaced <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> with a brand new one. now i get 5v on both ports. top port, gets 5v and marks 0.07A and keeps ampmeter turned on. bottom port, marks 5v volts too, but draws 0.3A, but ampmeters keeps on resetting. when i tested with the top port i dont get <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 1.5v. with bottom port, i get a pulses on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and  5v pulses on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>...moreover, bottom port works only on one side, if i turn the plug around it doesnt work. i guess the usb c port itself is corroded?

threads.title: 820 00840 not power on.
threads.message:
PLEASE, write correct sentences.
You are the first interested to be correctly understood by others.

threads.title: 820 00840 not power on.
threads.message:
shorted <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>. replaced with brand new one.

Now i get 5v on both ports.

when i connect charger on port corresponding to <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>, i get 5v with 0.3A. but  type C ampmeter  keeps turning on and off. i get voltage at <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> when ampmeter is on.

when i connect charger on port corresponding to <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>, i get 5v with 0.1A. type C ampmeter keeps steady, but i dont get <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> or <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 820 00840 not power on.
threads.message:
"i get voltage at <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> when ampmeter is on"
Can we know these voltages?

Board has different behaviour on the USB-C ports, so you still have problems with one port.

"Compare diode mode readings on all power rails of both <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips."
You still need to do that...

threads.title: 820 00840 not power on.
threads.message:
if i connect throught <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> port, i get 3v at <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and 5V at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. mind you these are only pulses, since the ampmeter keeps on turning on and off...

when connected through <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> port, i get 0v at <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and 2v at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 820 00840 not power on.
threads.message: ill compare all readings now on both ports.

threads.title: 820 00840 not power on.
threads.message: Be sure you don't have a short between <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> and F7000.

threads.title: 820 00840 not power on.
threads.message:
there is no short between <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> and F7000.

i checked all rails in both <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>. there is a issue in <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> i get all rails on <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>. everything pulses.

In <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> i dont get any rail. another bad chip?. or where should i check?.

threads.title: 820 00840 not power on.
threads.message:
in <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>, <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_BUS</SIGNAL> i get 45 in diode mode.

In <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> , at <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XB_BUS</SIGNAL> i get a open circuit...

threads.title: 820 00840 not power on.
threads.message:
I reflowed <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>. now the port for <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> stopped shutting on/off the amp meter. still when i connect thorough the port of <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> there are rails that dont come up...

another bad <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>?, or is there something else to check??

threads.title: 820 00840 not power on.
threads.message:
Compare the readings for ALL power rails of both <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.
Even better to compare with known working board.
Post here the values if not; maybe someone else gets time to compare with another board.
